title: come eliminare la tabella che compare all'inizio del messaggio che si inoltra
content: Salve. Da un certo momento in poi, che non so più individuare, ogni volta che inoltro un messaggio prima del suo testo, anzichè le poche informazioni utili che prima comparivano (data, mittente, destinatario e oggetto del messaggio inoltrato) mi compare una tabella interminabile (una cinquantina di righe, alcune delle quali contengono anche molte righe di testo che va a capo - vedi immagine allegata) di nessuna utilità per il ricevente. Ogni volta mi vedo costretto a cancellare la tabella, che però si svuota ma non sparisce e continua a occupare spazio a meno che non cancelli anche l'header "-------- Messaggio Inoltrato --------", che però è utile per separare il testo del messaggio inoltrato dal testo del messaggio che lo inoltra. Ho cercato dappertutto fra le configurazioni, ma non ho trovato nulla che serva a accendere o spegnere questa tabella, che è senz'altro utile se si debba fare del debug, ma non nell'uso abituale. Ringrazio in anticipo chi potrà dirmi come toglierla di mezzo.
creator: musicante-ritmico

title: Can't accept calendar invites into Google (calDAV) calendar
content:
I have 3 calendars in my Lightning calendar interface. Two are stored locally, one is labeled "Home", the other is "Recurring". I also have a Google calendar named "Shared". I can create and save events into any of these calendars and I can move events between calendars using the context-click "Edit". But if I receive an invite in email, when I accept it I am offered only the choice of "Home" and "Recurring". I cannot save it to "Shared". When I open the event, I am not offered a choice of calendar. I believe in the past I could accept invites into the "Shared" google calendar, but I might be wrong about that.

128.6.0esr (64bit) on Win11
creator: firefox179

title: Filtering and Searching in an MBOX
content:
How do I filter and search for dates in an MBOX on Thunderbird? The search seems to only go through email accounts and not Local MBOX files.

FYI I am using the extension ImportExportTools NG to open the MBOX file. And this picture shows that I can Sort by Date, either newest or oldest first but that's not what I want. I want to filter to a specific range between 2 dates or search for all emails from a specific date. How I can do this?

title: What does this messsage mean?  "Thunderbird could not install this item because “install-i1r..rdf” (provided by the item) is not well-formed or does not exist.  Please contact the author about this problem."
content:
What does this messsage mean? "Thunderbird could not install this item because “install-i1r..rdf” (provided by the item) is not well-formed or does not exist. Please contact the author about this problem."

Also, I get an error message whenever I try to send an email, saying it could not be sent because connecting to SMTP server secure219.inmotionhosting.com failed. Please verify that your SMTP server setting is correct and try again, or else contact your network administrator. I don't think the problem is with inmotionhosting because my husband can send email from his computer. I suspect the problem is with my Thunderbird setup.
creator: kris43

title: Why multiples profiles folders ?
content:
Hello, I have read various post saying the profiles folder is %APPDATA%\Thunderbird\Profiles\ but on my side I have many folder, and it can explain why when I use a backup tool, I loose all my e-mail. I have - C:\Users\Me\AppData\Local\Thunderbird\Profiles - C:\Users\Me\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles - C:\Users\Me\Administrateur\Application Data\Thunderbird\Profiles

And how to have only one ? I have tried to edit setting to use only C:\Users\Me\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles but the application refuse it.
creator: fred.ytrez987
